title: Departments - IGERT Electronic Security and Privacy: Technological, Human, Enterprise, and Legal Considerations
contents: Search this site     Program Overview Sponsors FAQ People Faculty Staff Fellows Associates Alumni Research Publications Curriculum Courses Seminars Outreach International Partners Links And Resources Internships CyberCorps SFS Alumni HS-STEM Scholarships Apply           News ESP-IGERT Calendar Departments Contact Us Sitemap          Program ‎ > ‎   Departments     Computer Science      The Computer Science Department is home to 100 PhD students, 130 MS students, and 320 undergraduate students. Its 30 faculty body is deeply engaged in research and education as demonstrated by an average of $6.5million/year in grants from NSF, DARPA, DoD, and NASA, and the five  UIC's Excellence in                             Teaching Awards received by its members.        CS Home Page  CS Admission Requirements and Application  CS PhD Degree Requirements    Electrical and Computer Engineering     The Electrical and Computer Engineering Department is home to 200 graduate, 450 undergraduate students and 30 faculty. Its faculty is engaged in several interdisciplinary research projects including computing and systems architecture, physics and electronic devices, and bio-engineering.       ECE Home Page    ECE Admission Requirements and Application  ECE PhD Degree Requirements     Communication      The Communication Department is home to 200 graduate and undergraduate students. Its 13 faculty body is engaged in world-renown research on the effects of new media in communications, social interactions mediated by the internet, and psychology.   Communication Home Page  Communication Admission Requirements and Application  Communication PhD Degree Requirements     Information and Decision Sciences        The Department of Information and Decision Sciences is home to 100 graduate and undergraduate students. Its 13 faculty body is committed to provide students with top education in the cutting-edge technologies that define successful businesses.   IDS Home Page  IDS Admissions Requirements and Application  IDS PhD Degree Requirements      Health Informatics and the Health Policy and Administration       The Program of Public Health Informatics and the Department of Health Policy and Administration Informatics are part of the School of Public Health at UIC. The Department of Health Policy and Administration is home to 400 students and 50 faculty, committed to teaching and research.
